questions.question_text:
A company manufactures custom medications.
You need to recommend a Dynamics 365 app that allows the company to manage the concentration of specific active ingredients, provide traceability of ingredients from supplier to customer, and substitute ingredients based on compound type.
What should you recommend?

discussion.content: The given answer is correct.

Selected Answer: A
Correct

correct

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
A company plans to implement enterprise asset management.
You need to recommend solutions for the company.
What should you recommend? To answer, drag the appropriate solutions to the correct requirements. Each solution may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content: Question 2, why not finance?

D365 Finance is the correct answers for both. Whenever it is cost or purchase price or financial aspect, it relates to D365 Finance. In Enterprise Asset Management there is no such report or inquiry showing these aspects. Though the documentation of MS shows the Asset Management being part of SCM, but these question being asked about financial aspects.
Supply Chain Management correct for both questions:
The first one is really tricky I thought it was Finance as the machine is a fixed asset property.

SCM for both is the correct answer: 
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/supply-chain/asset-management/

Asset Management is an advanced module for managing assets and maintenance jobs in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management. Asset Management integrates seamlessly with several other finance and operations apps.

I agree Question 2 answer could be Supply Chain Management, as the references to maintenance and labor could be those aspects themselves apart from their costs. However, Question 1 should be FInance -- a "large machine" is absolutely a Fixed Asset.
Tricky question... "a company plans to implement enterprise asset management" EAM means Supply Chain Management.
The minute you specify "acquisition costs", you have to track those using Fixed Assets, part of the Finance application.
This questions are similar to MB-910 or CRM Fundamentals exam, the answers are correct.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/supply-chain/asset-management/objects/introduction-to-objects
Asset Management is an advanced module for managing assets and maintenance jobs in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management.

comments.content: Check this out: "Each solution may be used once, more than once, or not at all."

discussion.content: its confusing, you can choose the same answer

It is tracked in Asset Management and Asset Management is part of Finance
In my point of Finance is correct answer

Selected Answer: D
Correct Answer
Correct answer.

questions.question_text:
A company plans to implement a manufacturing solution that includes integrated rate shipping costs for distribution.
You need to recommend a product to the company.
What should you recommend?

discussion.content: B is correct. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/finance/general-ledger/one-voucher

Selected Answer: B
Correct

questions.question_text:
A customer owes two vendors $500 each for services performed. The customer wants to post a lump sum of $1,000 to a bank to cover the payments.
You need to be able to track vendor payments individually.
Which feature should you recommend?

discussion.content: Correct
Given answer is correct, per the link given: "In Dynamics 365 Commerce, you can set up simple or complex loyalty programs that apply across your legal entities in any commerce channel."

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
A retailer plans to award its customers based on the amount of money they spend. The retailer has not previously offered a customer reward program.
You need to recommend a method for tracking customer spending.
What should you recommend? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//
